meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: INTERACTIVE INFOGRAPHIC

div.a: What's A College Degree Worth Today?

div.div: How much money are students spending on their postsecondary degrees and is this financial investment paying off?
AVIATION

div.a: Did FAA Managers Urge Employees To Vote Democrat?

div.div: FAA managers in Seattle warned workers that a Republican Presidential and Congressional wins would mean budget cuts for the agency, according to a government transparency group.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Rmvmsq&via=Digg&text=Did FAA Managers Urge Employees To Vote Democrat?

div.div: ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TAXES?!

div.a: In Stadium Building Spree, U.S. Taxpayers Lose $4 Billion

div.div: New York Giants fans will cheer on their team against the Dallas Cowboys at tonight’s National Football League opener in New Jersey. At tax time, they’ll help pay for the opponents’ $1.2 billion home field in Texas.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q4jTU7&via=Digg&text=In Stadium Building Spree, U.S. Taxpayers Lose $4 Billion

div.div: THE END TIMES ARE NEAR

div.a: CNBC Asks Kim Kardashian For Her Take On The Economy

div.div: Did the Mayans say anything about a Kardashian?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q9VgQo&via=Digg&text=CNBC Asks Kim Kardashian For Her Take On The Economy

div.div: PRICE WARS

div.a: Don't Like This Price? Wait A Minute

div.div: The fast-moving Internet pricing games used by airlines and hotels are now moving deeper into the most mundane nooks of the consumer economy. Retailers are changing the price of products from toilet paper to bicycles on an hour-by-hour and sometimes minute-by-minute basis.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Nds6DE&via=Digg&text=Don't Like This Price? Wait A Minute

div.div: APPLE

div.a: First Video Of An iPhone 5 Booting Up

div.div: At this stage of the proceedings, Foxconn must be churning a triillion iPhone 5 units per second, getting ready for the September 12 launch. Nor surprisingly, it seems someone managed to smuggle one out of a factory in Jincheng, China. Not just parts, but an entire unit.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tn8az8&via=Digg&text=First Video Of An iPhone 5 Booting Up

div.div: ROBOTS

div.a: DARPA's Cheetah Robot Can Now Outrun Usain Bolt

div.div: One year ago, the military set out to design a four-legged robot capable of doing mad sprints. Called Cheetah, the robot was meant to be ultra-speedy and agile. Now it's faster than the world's fasted man.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SkOhuV&via=Digg&text=DARPA's Cheetah Robot Can Now Outrun Usain Bolt

div.div: STILL #1 IN OBESITY

div.a: U.S. Slips In Global Competitiveness Ranking

div.div: The United States has slipped further down a global ranking of the world's most competitive economies, according to a World Economic Forum survey released on Wednesday.
SUIT UP

div.a: How Hard Is It To Make A Bespoke Suit?

div.div: Bespoke suit makers, maybe the world’s second-oldest profession, are struggling to survive. This is puzzling on a number of levels.

li.div: A look inside Martin Greenfield's suit-making plant in Williamsburg, one of New York's last big garment factories 6thfloor.blogs.nytimes.com/201...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OPqIVG&via=Digg&text=How Hard Is It To Make A Bespoke Suit?

div.div: GIVE HIM YOUR KOPEKS

div.a: Russian Subway Musician Sounds Just Like Kurt Cobain

div.div: It’s uncanny. He sounds like he’s singing through a hernia, just like the real Kurt.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OZxCK8&via=Digg&text=Russian Subway Musician Sounds Just Like Kurt Cobain

div.div: CREATING THE CLOUD
Eric Brewer has been tasked with designing the next generation of infrastructure at Google.

li.div: a re-wiring article on wired. like the premise RT @WiredFeed Meet the Man Who's Rewiring Google From the Inside Out wired.com/wiredenterprise/...

div.div: TEENAGERS
As research builds on the affects circadian rhythms have on teenagers, schools are beginning to consider the benefits of delaying first period.
DRONES

div.a: How Terrified Should We Be Of The Pentagon's Plan To Automize Drones?

div.div: The Air Force wants to automate more drones to save on costs, but what does that mean for the future of the program?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OYmEoj&via=Digg&text=How Terrified Should We Be Of The Pentagon's Plan To Automize Drones?

div.div: PHEW

div.a: The Internet Has No Off Switch, Says Tim Berners-Lee

div.div: There is no "off switch" for the internet, says the British inventor of the world wide web – and that is a good thing, because it could only be undone by governments around the world coordinating to turn it into a centralized system.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NRMupH&via=Digg&text=The Internet Has No Off Switch, Says Tim Berners-Lee

div.div: HISTORICAL HYPOTHETICALS

div.a: In a Mass Knife Fight To The Death Between Every American President, Who Would Win and Why?

div.div: Lincoln's got the reach, but Nixon's got the rage.

li.div: Ok, this is funny. What if the 44 Presidents had to play the Hunger Games? faceintheblue.wordpress.com/20...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PnBa65&via=Digg&text=In a Mass Knife Fight To The Death Between Every American President, Who Would Win and Why?

div.div: POLITICS

div.a: Paul Ryan Caught Making Dubious Claims About Mountains

div.div: Ryan has told his hometown paper that he has climbed "close to 40" of the famous "Fourteeners" in Colorado. Local residents are largely skeptical of the claim.

li.div: New Paul Ryan claim: Says he climbed "about 40" of Colorado's Fourteeners. theatlantic.com/politics/a... Part of his marathon training, perhaps.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OY5UvH&via=Digg&text=Paul Ryan Caught Making Dubious Claims About Mountains

div.div: THINGS THAT GO 'BOOM'

div.a: New Explosive Could Replace Replace HMX

div.div: Borrowing a technology used to improve the effectiveness of drugs, scientists are reporting discovery of a new explosive more powerful than the current state-of-the-art explosive used by the military, and just as safe for personnel to handle.
YOU'LL NEVER ESCAPE

div.a: Email Will Never Die - The Man Who Invented It Reveals Why

div.div: Texting, instant messaging, Facebook, Twitter - we have dozens of ways to pass a message from one user to the next, and yet we keep coming back to email. Why? According to the man who sent the first one, because there’s still nothing quite like it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OUtyL7&via=Digg&text=Email Will Never Die - The Man Who Invented It Reveals Why
